sentences.en: Do you suppose our mathematicians are unequal to that?
sentences.cn: 你以为我们的数学家做不到这一点 吗 ?

sentences.en: Exchange of unequal values makes the poor countries poorer.
sentences.cn: 不等价交换使穷国更穷.

sentences.en: He was unequal to the job.
Her feet are of unequal size.
sentences.cn: 她的两只脚大小不一样.

sentences.en: I feel unequal to the task.
sentences.cn: 我觉得难以胜任这项工作.

sentences.en: Keith felt unequal to the effort.
sentences.cn: 基思觉得辜负了这番努力.

sentences.en: Railroad companies often charged unequal or unfair rates.
sentences.cn: 铁路公司定价常常不合理.

sentences.en: She felt unequal to the task.
sentences.cn: 她觉得不能胜任这项工作.

sentences.en: The areas under the two resonance envelopes are unequal.
sentences.cn: 两个共振峰下面的面积是不相等的.

sentences.en: The correlations are of unequal value.
sentences.cn: 这些对应联系的价值并不相同.

sentences.en: The Egyptians probably measured their day in twenty-four hours of unequal length.
sentences.cn: 埃及人很有可能用不同长度的24小时来度量日子。

sentences.en: The imperialist powers forced the Qing Dynasty to sign a series of unequal treaties.
sentences.cn: 帝国主义列强迫使清王朝签订了一系列不平等条约.

sentences.en: The twins are unequal in height.
sentences.cn: 这一对孪生儿高矮不一样.

sentences.en: These unequal treaties were made under duress.
sentences.cn: 这些不平等条约是在强迫下签订的.

words.tran_cn: 不相等地；不均匀地；不公平地

trans.tran_cn: 不平等的，不均匀的，不规则的，不胜任的
trans.tran_en: used to describe a situation or a social system which is unfair because some groups or people have more power than others
